title: Gogo (1992) Genesis Portion
description:
Gogo is a Bantu language spoken by the Gogo people of the Dodoma Region in Tanzania. The language is spoken throughout Dodoma Region and into the neighboring district of Manyoni.

The language is considered to have three dialects: Nyambwa (Cinyambwa or West Gogo), spoken to the west of Dodoma and in Manyoni, Nyaugogo (Cinyaugogo or Central Gogo), spoken in the environs of Dodoma and Tumba (Citumba or East Gogo), spoken to the east.

language.name: Gogo
language.area: Dodoma region; Singida region, Manyoni District.
